results.title: Journey back
results.brief_description: Dramatised account of the rehabilitation of a hemiplegic patient. Deals with the cause and extent of paralysis and demonstrates the work of physical, occupational, recreational and speech therapists and their contribution to the recovery of the patient.

results.title: Jour de fete [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Fred Orain, Francinex and Jacques Tati
results.brief_description: Jacques Tati’s award winning feature debut is an hilarious expose of the modern obsession with speed and efficiency, set amidst the rural surroundings of a tiny French village. The arrival of the summer fair brings a frenzy of activity as children, villagers and showmen bustle to cram as much as possible into twenty four fun-packed hours. But when the local postman attempts the high speed methods of the American mail service the villagers experience a new kind of madness. Also available on VHS [301871].

results.title: Joshua in a box
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow Productions and John Lange
results.brief_description: An animated film which uses the situation of a boy being trapped in a box as a basis for a study of needs, emotions and values. No commentary, music and sound effects only.

results.title: Joshua Cooks & Dragon
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Penny Robenstone and Lucy MacLaren
results.brief_description: Through making a cake, a little boy gains some sense of independence and growth. Within this he struggles with fantasy versus reality to achieve an end product he can be proud of. Plus the story of two young girls who leave a dragon on a tram and go to the depot at night to find it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Penny Robenstone and Lucy MacLaren

results.title: Joshua and the shadow
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow Productions, Joshua Films, John Lange and Kandi Lange
results.brief_description: Deals with the way people react to themselves by telling a story in animation about a man who reacts to his shadow in many ways, from avoidance to aggression, until he discovers light, a tool with which he can control his shadow. Compares this to the tool of understanding, used to control emotional shadows. No commentary, music and sound effects only.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Bosustow Productions, Joshua Films, John Lange and Kandi Lange

results.title: Joshua and the blob
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow, Joshua Films, Stephen Bosustow Productions and John Lange
results.brief_description: Deals with the effect of external influences on a person’s thoughts and behaviour by telling about a person who reacts in various ways to a creature he does not understand. Shows that as his knowledge increases, his behaviour is more effective and his reactions more positive. Animated.
